question:
[Reynaldo]'s son, [Philip], was mowing the lawn. [Reynaldo]'s sister, [Martha], asked [Philip] if he wanted some lemonade. [Michael] loved going to the store with his mom [Martha]. She always bought him snacks [Elizabeth] went to her son [Donald]'s House [Philip]'s aunt, [Elizabeth], took him to the zoo. [Brandi] went to her brother [Michael]'s birthday party [Donald]'s grandmother, [Carmelita], made him some cookies.
Question: How is [Carmelita] related to [Brandi]?

teacher_log.content:
You are a knowledgeable and patient professor whose role is to guide students in solving problems correctly.
Here is a question:
[Reynaldo]'s son, [Philip], was mowing the lawn. [Reynaldo]'s sister, [Martha], asked [Philip] if he wanted some lemonade. [Michael] loved going to the store with his mom [Martha]. She always bought him snacks [Elizabeth] went to her son [Donald]'s House [Philip]'s aunt, [Elizabeth], took him to the zoo. [Brandi] went to her brother [Michael]'s birthday party [Donald]'s grandmother, [Carmelita], made him some cookies.
Question: How is [Carmelita] related to [Brandi]?
Task:
The question contains a large set of semi-synthetic stories involving hypothetical families. 
The task is to infer the relationship between two family members, whose relationship is not explicitly mentioned in the given story.
please provide a detailed analysis.
Note: Since your responsibility is to guide students in answering the question, your analysis should think step by step, 
Please note that your role is to guide them step by step through the problem, so please don't give them the final result

Step 1: Identify the family members mentioned in the story
- [Reynaldo] (father)
- [Philip] (son)
- [Martha] (sister of [Reynaldo])
- [Michael] (son of [Martha])
- [Elizabeth] (mother of [Donald] and aunt of [Philip])
- [Donald] (son of [Elizabeth])
- [Carmelita] (grandmother of [Donald] and great-aunt of [Philip])
- [Brandi] (sister of [Michael])

Step 2: Identify the relationship between [Carmelita] and [Brandi]
- [Carmelita] is the grandmother of [Donald]
- [Donald] is the son of [Elizabeth]
- [Elizabeth] is the mother of [Michael]
- [Michael] is the brother of [Brandi]

Step 3: Analyze the relationship between [Carmelita] and [Brandi]
- [Carmelita] is the grandmother of [Donald], who is the brother of [Brandi]'s brother [Michael]. This makes [Carmelita] the great-grandmother of [Brandi].

Step 4: Conclusion
- Based on the given information, [Carmelita] is the great-grandmother of [Brandi].
